Name: Vase with false decoration
Description: This wooden jar, part of the Hilton Price collection, probably comes from a tomb at Gebelein. It is ornamented by a decoration imitating a red stone with white marks. This type of jar belong to a family of receptacles of different forms which served to contain oils and unguents.  Generally made in hard stone, they were also fashioned from wood and terracotta receiving in this way a ficticious and symbolic characteristic. They have practically always been found in a funerary context.
